title: Ed Sheeran's manager reveals the singer puts 'stupid' clauses into his contract for a laugh
text:
Ed Sheeran's manager Stuart Camp has revealed the singer often inserts 'stupid' clauses into his contract for a laugh.

The Shape of You hitmaker, 28, most recently said that he must carry a laminated picture of the Weasley twins from Harry Potter in his wallet at all times.

Speaking to Rob Adcock on the new BBC Introducing podcast being launched at the end of the October, Stuart said: 'The deal I get nervous with is my own management deal with Ed Sheeran because every year he puts a stupid clause in it that I have to proceed with.'

Having a laugh: Ed Sheeran 's manager Stuart Camp has revealed the singer often inserts 'stupid' clauses into his contract for a laugh. Pictured in July 2019

'It’s the honest to God truth. I have to carry a picture of them in my wallet at all times. I have a little laminated card of those lovely twins. I have to have that with me at all times. It’s in my management contract.'

'There’s a picture of the two twins from Harry Potter, behind me, that rises up from the wall. That’s a clause in my contract with him. Stupid things like that.

'[Ed]’s actually misunderstood the contract. He thinks I have to show it to people everywhere I go. If I’m in [a magazine] and there isn’t a picture of it, he rings me and says "you’re in breach [of the contract]".'

Pic: Ed most recently said that his manager must carry a laminated picture of Harry Potter's Weasley twins, played by James and Oliver Phelps, in his wallet at all times. Pictured in 2002

Stuart has been Ed’s manager since 2011 and the pair have also recently opened a pub called Bertie Blossoms in Notting Hill.

'We had some property that we were going to look into making into a restaurant a few years ago and we just decided we’d make it into a bar. For little else than the fact that we’d like to say we own a bar,' Stuart said.

‘I tried to go behind the bar and they said, "You’re not allowed behind the bar." I don’t know if I’m not allowed to serve or they didn’t want me there. Ed got behind the bar, he was serving drinks.'

Longtime partnership: Stuart Camp has been Ed’s manager since 2011 and the pair have also recently opened a pub called Bertie Blossoms in Notting Hill, west London

Ed is currently on a break from music after the singer confirmed he would be taking eighteen months off from touring and public appearances.

As well as being preoccupied with his new pub, Ed has also taken up painting during his down time.

'Annoyingly, he’s quite good at everything,' Stuart said. 'It’s the first time, to my knowledge, he’s really tried painting. But this actually, frustratingly, is not that bad!’

Bertie Blossoms opened last month ex-England footballer Peter Crouch and his model wife Abbey were among the celebs at the launch night.

Movies: The brothers played Fred and George Weasley in the hugely popular Harry Potter films

It comes following news that the singer made an incredible £65,000 a day in 2018, making him the highest-earning British solo artist.

Accounts released at the beginning of this month show his company, Ed Sheeran Ltd, made a gross profit of £23,770,262, equating to £65,124 a day.

The singer earned more than twice as much as he made in 2016 and over the last three years has made a gross profit of a staggering £61,826,786.
